messages.title: Vote Labour 8 June
messages.content: Dear Resident, I am proud to be your local Labour candidate for the election on June 8th. Send me to fight for your corner in Parliament. I will never be scared to stand up for the things I believe in and the place I live. On current national polling the Conservatives would win again in Erewash – leaving us with a Conservative Borough Council, a Conservative County Council, a Conservative Government and a Conservative MP. It is worth considering that for a moment. No one locally to challenge government plans for more cuts to our NHS, social care, schools, the police and other public services. No one to hold the account of all the broken promises they made in 2015 to balance the books and cut taxes. No one to stand up for jobs, investment and living standards as we exit the EU. If you believe it’s important for the health of our democracy to have someone at Westminster providing real challenge, I hope that, whatever your normal political colour, you will consider voting for me in Erewash in this election. When you vote on June 8th you are electing the person you want to be your local MP for the next five years. I hope you put your trust in me to be your voice and stand up for local people. Yours sincerely, Catherine Atkinson

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Four new bank holidays on UK patron saints’ days.
A £10 minimum wage and an end to the pay cap for those who work in the public sector including the NHS.
Protect the pensions 'triple lock' so pensions rise every year - pensioners better off with Labour.
10,000 more police to tackle crime, paid for by reversing the cut to capital gains tax.
Halt all Conservative plans to close hospitals. The NHS under Labour will get the funding needed and will be protected from Tory privatisation.
Reintroduce an education maintenance allowance for 16 & 17 year olds in full time education to help low and middle income families.
Increase the carer’s allowance by £10 per week.
Free school meals for all primary school children, paid for by VAT on private schools, so every child can class ties.
A Brexit deal that is in the interests of Erewash’s businesses and families not an extreme Tory Brexit which will damage trade and jobs.
I pledge to support our armed forces. My husband served as a soldier in Afghanistan and I will always work to ensure that our forces are properly equipped and looked after.

quotes.text: We don’t need another Conservative MP to nod through Government policies - we need a fighter who will put local people first.
